IX.iii.1.G.4.b
.
Requirements for a Medical Expense Deduction Claim
A claim for a medical expense deduction that will result in increased benefit payments must be initiated by a
fully completed
VA Form 21P-8416, Medical Expense Report
standard form listed in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 1.A.1
that requests information consistent with what is requested on
VA Form 21P-8416
such as
VA Form 21P-527EZ, Application for Veterans Pension
and
VA Form 21P-534EZ, Application for DIC, Survivors Pension, and/or Accrued Benefits
, or
proper standard form accompanying evidence of paid medical expenses that is appropriate to the benefit sought as discussed in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 1.A.2.c
.
Note
:  Claimants are not required to submit the worksheets that are attached to standard forms for caregiver fees, assisted living fees, adult day care fees, or similar expenses to have the expenses considered as a deduction from countable income.
Example
:
Surviving spouse submits
VA Form 21P-0518-1, Improved Pension Eligibility Verification Report (Surviving Spouse With No Children)
, a statement from a caregiver, and various receipts from a pharmacy showing medications purchased.  The surviving spouse does not list the medical expenses on
VA Form 21P-0518-1
and does not indicate for whom the medications or the caregiver fees were paid and who paid the medical expenses.
Result
:
Telephone development or development for
VA Form 21P-8416
is required since the medical expenses are considered claimed, but the information for whom paid and who paid is missing.  Do not assume the expenses were paid by the claimant because a receipt was sent.
References
:  For more information on
medical expense reporting, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.G.4.a
in-home attendants for a disabled person, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.G.3.m
, and
medical expense deductions for a care facility other than a nursing home, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.G.3.k
.
